Try uninstalling league of legends.  A complete uninstall, not just the application.  The items you should remove are: "League of Legends Preferences", "com.transgaming.cider.leagueoflegends", and "LolClient".  you can do a spotlight search for them, or go to /Users/YourUsername/Library/Preferences for "LolClient" and "League of Legends Preferences", and /Users/YourUserName/Library/Cache for "com.transgaming.cider.leagueoflegends".  once you've uninstalled those, reinstall League of Legends.  If that doesn't work, post back here again and I'll see what else i can do to help you.

Also, you might want to check out the official League of Legends Mac Testing forums if you need help with specific problems, somebody may have had the same problem and already figured it out.  The Mac Testing Forums can be found here:
http://www.leagueoflegends.com/board/forumdisplay.php?f=31
Hi, and can u tell me how can i change US server to EU? Btw the game works just fine thanks for it, but i just dont want to lose my many characters.

To play on an EU server with the Mac client, you have to manually edit one of the files.  Heres how:

1. Go to /Applications/League of Legends.app/Contents/Resources/transgaming/c_drive/rads/projects/lol_air_client_config_na/releases/0.0.0.0/deploy (In order to get to the /Contents portion of the League of Legends.app, you have to right click on it and choose "Show Package Contents")

2. Open lol.properties and paste this:

#host=beta.lol.riotgames.com
#xmpp_server_url=chat.na.lol.riotgames.com
host=prod.eu.lol.riotgames.com
xmpp_server_url=chat.eu.lol.riotgames.com
enableTutorialGame=true
lobbyLandingURL=http://www.leagueoflegends.com/pvpnet_landing
ladderURL=http://www.leagueoflegends.com/ladders
storyPageURL=http://www.leagueoflegends.com/story

This should change the client to play on the EU servers.  If you want to switch back to the US servers, go to the same lol.properties file, and delete the # from the first two lines, and put them in the beginning of the 3rd and 4th lines.  Credit for this goes to Xulrock.
If i change the contents of that text file, when i launch the game the LoL client will change it back.

I believe that what you had to do for that file is delete everything inside of it, then paste the code in my comment above into the file.  Once you've done that (there should be no other text except the code above) you need to save the file then run the League of Legends.app, and it should download all of the EU patches and let you play on the EU server.  If nothing else helps, you can go here: 
http://www.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=280834&page=2
If that doesn't work, i'm not sure what else i can do to help you.  You can post in the mac testing forums at: http://www.leagueoflegends.com/board/forumdisplay.php?f=31
just don't mention that you downloaded the client from a torrent, and people with more knowledge about the EU client of LoL will help you.

Poeticile, have you tried uninstalling EVERYTHING like i listed in the third comment on this page?  Simply dragging the application from your applications folder to the trash bin and deleting it will not get rid of a problem if the problem is not in the application itself.  You have to uninstall "League of Legends Preferences" and "LolClient" at /users/YourUserName/Library/Preferences, and "com.transgaming.cider.leagueoflegends" at /users/YourUserName/Library/Cache.  If you have uninstalled those and reinstalled it and the application still doesn't work, then the LeagueofLegendsBeta.dmg may have been corrupted during your torrent download, and you'll have to redownload it.

Khendrix's post is right, the guide he linked to does actually have links to download an already modded mac LoL client in case anyone is having trouble with my previous post about how to make the mac US client play on EU servers instead.  However, i still recommend using the code i posted.  The only difference between the code i posted and the code at Khendrix's link is that the first two lines, which are used for playing on the US servers, are commented out with # (basically making it so that the code is still there in case you want to change back to the US servers, but the application won't read them because of the #).

As far as I can tell, the freezing on the patcher seems to be happening to quite a few people.  Thankfully, Riot has integrated a download manager with their patcher, so if it freezes, just quit the patcher and start it up again.  Your download should start from where it left off and you'll be good to go.

Yes Stagism, this version is still working.  The .dmg doesn't change, so as long as the Mac version of League of Legends is still in beta, this version will be fine.  The only changes to this file that occur are the updates that are downloaded through the patcher.

Hey guys, Tihzz is correct.  Riot is blocking all Mac clients from accessing their servers starting today.  I'm a little bit behind on this news, and only just found out, so within the next few hours I will have another torrent up for League of Legends on Mac.

If you would rather not wait, or would rather not download the whole game again, then there is a simple way to get your Mac client working.

1) Download the LoLlauncher.exe from here (http://zzj.itf-inc.com/downloads/LoLLauncher.exe)

2) Right click on your Mac League of Legends and choose "Show Package Contents"

3) Navigate to the /Contents/Resources/transgaming/c_drive/rads/projects/lol_launcher/releases/0.0.0.33/deploy/

4) Take the LoLLauncher.exe that you just downloaded, and replace the LoLLauncher.exe in the deploy folder that you just navigated to with it.

5) Enjoy!

Again, for those of you who feel intimidated or just can't get this to work for yourself, I will have another torrent up in a couple of hours that you can download and will be playable.
...Why does this work? LOL.

The simple explanation of why this works is that Riot and Transgaming partnered up to make a "wrapper" for the League of Legends PC version.  Removing the modified LoLLauncher.exe that came with the Mac beta leaves you with just the wrapper left, and inserting the LoLLauncher.exe from the download link fools the server into thinking you are playing on the windows client
Ah, so we will have to do this each time there is a patch? Do you just patch it on windows and use that .exe for the mac side?
Unfortunately that is not a question I will be able to accurately answer until a patch comes out and I can test it.  I believe, however, that this will patch normally just like any other time.
